resources:
IllumiSmart IllumiSmart Self-Assessment Evaluate the lighting condition of your workplace by answering a few questions. Measure Light Level A quick tool to check whether your working area is too bright or too dark. A quick tool to check whether there is flicker hazard. Detect Light Flicker Detect Glarez Glare event: True Glare event: False A quick tool to check whether there is glare hazard. Light level is an important factor in the workplace. To measure the illuminance using this function:

 1. Push 			 to start recording 
 2. Face the light sensor up 
 3. Moving the phone horizontally and slowly around the working area 
 4. Push 			 to pause recording 

 In addition:
 		 : Reset the light meter 
 		 : Save the measurement data Unsteady light may do harm to human and become safety hazards. To detect the possible flicker using this function: 

 1. Face the light sensor direct to the light source 
 2. Push 			 to start detecting 
 3. The Fluctuation Rate of the light source and whether it is a possible visible flicker will be displayed after 10 seconds 

 In addition:
 		 : Reset the detector 
 		 : Save the measurement data No flicker event detected. It seems this light source is a possible flicker. It seems this light source is a certain visible flicker. The average lighting level is below the guideline suggestions. The average lighting level is above the guideline suggestions The average lighting level follows the guidance. View Details According to your age and type of task being done, the recommended illuminance is: If the measured average light level is under the guidance, view Correction of Insufficient Light If the measured average light level is above the guidance, it is suggested to conduct a glare test next. Which of the following answers best describes your work type? Examples: Storeroom… Examples: Packing; despatch… Examples: Simple assembly; locksmith’s work; winding thick wire onto spools; work on carpenter’s bench; milling… Examples: Reading; writing; book-keeping; laboratory technician; assembly of fine equipment; woodworking by machine; fine work on toolmaking gig… Examples: Technical drawing; colour proofing; adjusting and testing electrical equipement; assembling delicate electronics; watchmaking; invisible mending What is your age? Do you work in the office or industry setting? Choose one of the following Are there any signs of frequent eye discomfort (e.g. eyestrain, blurred vision...) and/or headaches? Back to the Previous Question Does your workplace have access to the natural light (sunlight) via windows? Are there blinds or curtains on windows? Do you have a computer in your working area and usually work with it? Which of the following answers best describes your desktop monitor position relative to the windows? Next to a window In front of a window Face to a window There is no window near my monitor Do you sometimes feel it is difficult to view the paper documents on the desk? Are there frequent transitions of vision between extremes of light and dark or near and far during working? When do you replace the light bulbs? When they stop working When the light is dimming or fluctuating On regular schedule Do you usually clean light fixtures, upper walls, ceilings and task stations? Yes, on regular schedule or whenever needed Never
